[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ReceiveProactiveRandShare] [Randomness correlation] Can attackers correlate proactive randomness share logs across validators to reconstruct secret random values? (High)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::BroadcastAugData] [Augmented data leakage] What cryptographic augmented data is logged, and could it expose validator private randomness state? (High)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::BroadcastRandShareFastPath] [Fast path timing] Does logging fast-path randomness events reveal timing side-channels that distinguish honest from Byzantine randomness contributions? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ProofOfStoreInit] [Transaction exposure] Does ProofOfStoreInit logging expose transaction batch contents before they are committed, enabling front-running attacks? (High)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ProofOfStoreCommit] [Commit verification] Are ProofOfStoreCommit events logged with sufficient cryptographic proof data to verify batch integrity in audit logs? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ReceiveBatchRetrieval] [Batch request tracking] Can Byzantine validators flood batch retrieval events to hide DoS attacks or create false audit trails? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::OptPropose] [Optimistic bypass] Does logging optimistic proposals separately from regular proposals create audit confusion that could hide consensus rule violations? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ProcessOptProposal] [Processing validation] Are optimistic proposal processing failures logged distinctly from successful processing to detect exploitation attempts? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ReceiveBlockRetrieval] [Block withholding] Can validators log ReceiveBlockRetrieval without actually serving blocks, hiding block withholding attacks? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ReceiveEpochChangeProof] [Epoch transition attack] Does logging epoch change proofs include validator set changes that could audit unauthorized validator additions? (High)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent::ReceiveNewCertificate] [Certificate validation] Are quorum certificate receipts logged with signature verification results to detect forged certificates? (High)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Type: Author] [Type confusion] Could the Author type be confused between local author and remote_peer fields, creating attribution errors in security audits? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Type: Round] [Integer overflow] Is the Round type (u64) logged safely without truncation or overflow when used in log formatting? (Low)
[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Type: HashValue] [Hash collision] If HashValue collisions occur, would log analysis mistakenly correlate unrelated consensus events? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [Race condition] Can concurrent threads log events with inconsistent field values (e.g., epoch=N with round from epoch=N+1) due to lack of synchronization? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Function: new()] [Thread safety] Is LogSchema construction thread-safe when called from multiple consensus threads simultaneously during epoch transitions? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent] [Performance monitoring] Are there events for tracking consensus performance metrics (block time, vote latency) needed to detect performance degradation attacks? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [Missing context] Does LogSchema lack critical security context like validator stake, voting power, or slashing status needed for comprehensive audits? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent] [Error events missing] Are consensus error conditions (invalid signatures, malformed proposals, timeout expirations) logged with specific events? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Overall design] [Log correlation attack] Can an attacker correlate logs across validators to deanonymize validator network connections and target specific validators? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Overall design] [Missing authentication] Are logged events authenticated to prevent log spoofing by compromised consensus components? (High)
[File: consensus/src/logging.rs] [Overall design] [Temporal ordering] Does LogSchema guarantee temporal ordering of events to prevent reordering attacks that hide consensus violations? (High)
